intro: Clutia richardiana var. trichophora, commonly known as the hairy clutia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The varietal name *trichophora* refers to its hairy foliage, a distinguishing feature of this plant.
